body:
Yes, great additions, great suggestions!

> Also should allow specifying `lr` either within the optimiser or as parameter to the class itself.

I think this one is unnecessary, because you can pass the `lr` to the optimizer, which is an object you would then pass to the classifier class constructor. We do not need two places to pass it?

Or, do you see a good argument why it would be useful to the user to pass `lr` separately? Or am I simply misunderstanding the suggestion?
all sounds like a good idea, can we keep the defaults the same to maintain reproducibility of results?

> can we keep the defaults the same to maintain reproducibility of results?

Changing defaults would require deprecation, so I would advise against changing defaults.

issue.title: [ENH] Changes to CNN Classifier

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
Fixes #2935 


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
- [ ] Moving the `convert_y_to_keras` function in `BaseDeepClassifier` into a utils function
- [x] Enable returning the `label_encoder` and `one hot encoder` to the user from `convert_y_to_keras` (it can be useful for the users in case they want to use it to encode other data / or to decode data later on)
- [x] Add option to have multiple linear layers in output layer / different activation function. Also add the `use_bias` parameter to output layer. (simply as a customisation option to users, multiple linear layers are useful to create deeper networks depending on dataset / choice of activation function)
- [x] option to choose optimiser (usually its Adam but just for customisation's sake we can give this as option as well). Also should allow specifying `lr` either within the optimiser or as parameter to the class itself.
- [x] Accept parameter as input in `CNNClassifier` to specify `random seed`
- [ ] Train/fit the model on GPU depending on users choice (maybe take an input parameter for this as well)
- [x] Option to view / return the loss of fit (either as a graph or simply as a list / array )

##### For all contributions
- [x] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [MNT], [DOC], or [BUG] indicating whether the PR topic is related to enhancement, maintenance, documentation, or bug.

<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

body: Another thing I was planning was to have `validation_split` as a parameter to make it easier for users. It is simply an additional parameter for us in the `model.fit` method, and should not be difficult. Only issue with this is are we going in accordance to other sktime estimators, do they have functionality to automate validation? In which case we should probably either add it for all (simply use sklearn's `train_test_split` or not use here as well)

issue.title: [ENH] Adding GPU / multi-GPU functionality to CNNClassifier

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
As discussed in dev-days  meeting on 15-07-2022 and #2935 , #2991 adding ability to run the neural models on GPU is extremely useful. We need to add functionality to support GPU and multi-GPU:

For GPU functionality:
1. A user would need tensorflow-gpu and cuda-toolkit installed. We will have to add them as a soft dependency? I am unsure if these are required since pytorch (which I am comfortable with) does not really require them
2. We can also have the functionality of multi-gpu: https://keras.io/guides/distributed_training/ . In my estimate majority of the people using sktime would be on kaggle / collab in which case there is a single gpu used. And time series data should not be so heavy that multi-gpu are required, but there might be few using it on larger data / maybe college gpu cluster where they might have easy access to gpus and would prefer running the models with multiple gpus? It might be worth having in those cases

body:
> Another thing I was planning was to have `validation_split` as a parameter to make it easier for users. It is simply an additional parameter for us in the `model.fit` method, and should not be difficult. Only issue with this is are we going in accordance to other sktime estimators, do they have functionality to automate validation? In which case we should probably either add it for all (simply use sklearn's `train_test_split` or not use here as well)

I think in general this is a good idea!

The specific implementation needs to be discussed though - we should not be adding parameters to `fit`, it is really important that all estimators "look the same".

What would the parameter do? And could it maybe be added as an init option?
Would be interested to see what you have in mind, if you could write it up, say, in the form of docstrings.
reopening as there are still two checkboxes open, we need to decide what to do with them before we close
Ok. Closing then, as two remaining bullet points are tracked in #3020 and #3190.

issue.title: [BUG] `CNNRegressor` missing essential initializing parameters

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
`CNNRegressor` misses parameters like `optimizer` in its constructor. There might be more things which don't coincide with `CNNClassifier` which should be added but since I'm not sure what all things might be missing, I'm opening this issue to bring it to notice.
